Articles.Content:
What a gui is for (linux joke)...

[www.abyteofcode.co.uk/imghost/gui.png](www.abyteofcode.co.uk/imghost/gui.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-24T12:40:05Z" title="04/24/2015 12:40  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 24, 2015</time> by kerbingamer376**
UI is user interface, not sure about the G...

Do I need to be a Linux user to get the humor in this?

Or is it just the joke that for some, using a command prompt is simply easier than pointing and clicking?

> 
> Do I need to be a Linux user to get the humor in this?
> Or is it just the joke that for some, using a command prompt is simply easier than pointing and clicking?

It's a linux joke

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> UI is user interface, not sure about the G...

GUI = Graphical UI
Is the joke that it's an HTML reference, rather than a BBCode one, and thus isn't an image or a hyperlink?

> 
> Is the joke that it's an HTML reference, rather than a BBCode one, and thus isn't an image or a hyperlink?

the joke is in the picture

Well, that's better than using ALT+F-Keys for multiple terminals ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I work with linux all day and i easily manage to work with 5 or more putty sessions at once. I do see a linux desktop two times a year if i'm lucky.

> 
> Well, that's better than using ALT+F-Keys for multiple terminals ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> I work with linux all day and i easily manage to work with 5 or more putty sessions at once. I do see a linux desktop two times a year if i'm lucky.

Lol. I see my desktop only when playing ksp
